name: José (Bermondsey Street)
short_title: Lively, walk-in Spanish tapas bar with cult-favourite classics
summary: José is the original, most informal tapas bar from chef José Pizarro and one of Bermondsey Street’s busiest spots. It’s walk-in only, tiny, and almost always buzzing—but for many diners, that’s part of the charm. Reviews consistently praise the authentic Spanish flavours, fast-moving plates, and standout classics, especially the tortilla and jamón.
what_diners_love: Runny, onion-sweet tortilla española often called one of the best in London
Authentic, no-nonsense Spanish flavours straight out of a tapas bar in Spain
Quick, efficient service that keeps plates coming even when it’s packed
Lively, convivial atmosphere with open kitchen and bar seating
Strong wine, sherry and vermouth selection (plus crisp Estrella)
Excellent people-watching from counter or outdoor seats
atmosphere_experience: Small, loud and energetic with tables close together and a constant flow of guests. Many diners love the buzzy, authentic tapas-bar feel, while others find it cramped or rushed at peak times. Counter seating by the open kitchen is a highlight for solo diners and food lovers.
good_to_know: Walk-ins only; queues are common but usually move quickly
Very limited space: close seating and noticeable noise during busy hours
Designed for quick, social eating rather than long leisurely meals
Portions are small; most diners order 2–3 dishes per person
Costs can add up quickly, especially with drinks
Vegetarian options available, but the menu is meat-led
mixed_feedback: Some diners feel rushed or pressured to order/leave during busy periods
Occasional comments about over-salting or inconsistency on certain dishes
Service can feel brisk or impersonal when at full capacity
best_for: Anyone chasing a true Spanish tapas-bar buzz
top_tip: Arrive earlier in the day or mid-afternoon to avoid the longest queues, and don’t leave without ordering the tortilla—it’s the dish that keeps people coming back.
